description:
I have a working OpenStack with 3 running servers and a few volumes (not all attached).

when calling the SimpleTenantUsage Extension i get the following response 

{"tenant_usages": [{"total_memory_mb_usage": 0.00035840000000000004, "total_vcpus_usage": 7.000000000000001e-07, "start": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181387", "tenant_id": "d8f0cd49971a44d187b454e14921056d", "stop": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181513", "total_hours": 7.000000000000001e-07, "total_local_gb_usage": 0.0}, {"total_memory_mb_usage": 0.0007168000000000001, "total_vcpus_usage": 3.5000000000000004e-07, "start": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181387", "tenant_id": "2b25129754c145de8426896b09a42106", "stop": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181513", "total_hours": 3.5000000000000004e-07, "total_local_gb_usage": 1.0500000000000001e-05}]}

the usage numbers that are returned are clearly too small for any machine...

note that the HostResourceUsage seems to be working fine.
title: SimpleTenantUsage Extension returns invalid data

comments.content:
I have a working OpenStack with 3 running servers and a few volumes (not all attached).

when calling the SimpleTenantUsage Extension i get the following response 

{"tenant_usages": [{"total_memory_mb_usage": 0.00035840000000000004, "total_vcpus_usage": 7.000000000000001e-07, "start": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181387", "tenant_id": "d8f0cd49971a44d187b454e14921056d", "stop": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181513", "total_hours": 7.000000000000001e-07, "total_local_gb_usage": 0.0}, {"total_memory_mb_usage": 0.0007168000000000001, "total_vcpus_usage": 3.5000000000000004e-07, "start": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181387", "tenant_id": "2b25129754c145de8426896b09a42106", "stop": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181513", "total_hours": 3.5000000000000004e-07, "total_local_gb_usage": 1.0500000000000001e-05}]}

the usage numbers that are returned are clearly too small for any machine...

note that the HostResourceUsage seems to be working fine.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~avi-ben-harush

comments.content:
The data you have here says that the request asked for usage for the time period:
     "start": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181387"
     "stop": "2012-05-02 13:15:52.181513"

That is a *very* small amount of time.  The rest of the results are data from the instance multiplied by the number of hours.  Since the time period is so small, that's why the rest of the results are so small.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
